passage_text: 1 Applicants who need their passports guaranteed in 14 days or less must apply in person at a regional passport agency. 2  The closest agencies to Ohio are the Detroit Passport Agency at 211 W. Fort St. and the Philadelphia Passport Agency at 200 Chestnut St., Room 103. 3  Call 877-487-2778 for an appointment. Before heading out on an international vacation, people who live in Ohio can apply for a passport from one of the hundreds of acceptance facilities situated throughout the state.

Passport Offices in Hamilton County. Hamilton County applicants looking to find a passport offices in Ohio would need to visit any of the 16 locations official US passport acceptance facilities located in Hamilton County. Ohio state has a total of 88 passport acceptance offices that you would be able to obtain a passport. The passport agent in Hamilton County would be able give you the passport form and witness your signature to obtain a passport.

Cincinnati Passport-Where to Apply for a Passport in Cincinnati, OH. Cincinnati passport facilities can be found in several locations throughout the city. New passport application Form DS-11 can be submitted at a nearby passport application acceptance facility so that an agent can administer an oath, witness the signing of the form and seal it with your supporting documents in an envelope.
Ohio has over 300 passport acceptance facilities where American citizens can apply for new passports. If none is available where you live, you will be directed to one in a neighboring city.

1 Renew Your Passport Renew by Mail You can renew your passport by mail with application DS-82 if you meet the criteria listed on the U.S. Department of State web site. 2  Renew by Mail Checklist You can also renew your passport by bringing your prepared renewal application to a Post Office™ location. 5136611033. You can submit the application for a passport at the regional processing center if you have urgent travel plans. If you are unable to travel from Cincinnati to the regional agency, you can have a registered expediting service submit the application for expedited passport service. New passport application Form DS-11 can be submitted at a nearby passport application acceptance facility so that an agent can administer an oath, witness the signing of the form and seal it with your supporting documents in an envelope.

A couple of other options availabe to residents of Cincinnati who want to apply for a passport are the regional agency and private expediting services. Passport Offices in Butler County. Butler County applicants looking to find a passport offices in Ohio would need to visit any of the 13 locations official US passport acceptance facilities located in Butler County. Ohio state has a total of 88 passport acceptance offices that you would be able to obtain a passport. The passport agent in Butler County would be able give you the passport form and witness your signature to obtain a passport. Passport acceptance agents at the Butler Offices require an appointment so you will have to call the postal office for an appointment.
